title: What Raiders GM John Spytek said about Maxx Crosby trade rumors
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Raiders GM John Spytek expects Maxx Crosby to remain with the team despite trade rumors after a 3-14 season.
Crosby, who signed a $106 million extension last March, is recovering from meniscus surgery but maintains a good relationship with Spytek.
Spytek, while not declaring Crosby untradeable, stated he is always listening, keeping options open for the Raiders' future.

title: Platner maintains big lead over Mills in Maine senate race, new poll finds
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Graham Platner holds a 64% to 26% lead over Gov. Janet Mills in Maine's Democratic Senate primary, UNH poll shows.
Platner also leads Republican Sen. Susan Collins 49% to 38% in a hypothetical general election matchup, per the poll.
Platner remains popular among younger voters and progressives, while Mills has stronger support from voters aged 65 and older.

title: R.I. college student dies of carbon monoxide poisoning while charging cellphone in car
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Joseph Boutros, 21, died from carbon monoxide poisoning while charging his phone in a snow-embedded car in Newport, R.I.
Boutros was discovered unconscious in an idling vehicle with a blocked exhaust during a wellness check on Bellevue Avenue.
Rhode Island's recent nor'easter contributed to the incident with Newport police warning about snow-blocked exhaust pipes.

title: Mass. hiker suffering medical emergency rescued from White Mountains
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 75-year-old hiker from Acton, Massachusetts, was rescued from Zealand Hut in the White Mountains after a medical emergency.
The New Hampshire Fish and Game Department assisted the hiker 2.2 miles down the trail in White Mountain National Forest.
The hiker was transported by snowmobile to Route 3 and taken to Littleton Regional Hospital via Twin Mountain Ambulance.

title: Man arrested for allegedly throwing dog off balcony while drunk in Milford
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alex De Oliveira, 25, arrested in Milford for allegedly throwing a dog off a balcony while intoxicated.
The injured dog was found in a snowbank and taken to Tufts Animal Hospital in Grafton for treatment.
De Oliveira charged with animal cruelty, disturbing the peace, and vandalizing property, and released on $5,000 bail.

title: 5 takeaways from Eliot Wolf’s press conference at the NFL Scouting Combine
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Eliot Wolf addressed the status of left-tackle Will Campbell, noting his struggles following an MCL injury.
Wolf dismissed reports linking the Patriots to acquiring Green Bay's left tackle Rasheed Walker.
No definitive decision has been made on Stefon Diggs's future; he remains under a $26.5 million cap hit for next season.

title: Mass. girl, 11, killed in Utah avalanche while vacationing with family
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Madelyn Eitas, 11, from Rochester, Massachusetts, died in an avalanche at the Rock Garden area near Brighton Ski Resort, Utah.
She was found by her brother using an app and was rushed to a local hospital but later succumbed to her injuries.
Rochester Memorial School and local soccer organizations mourn Eitas's passing, offering condolences and dedicating the soccer season in her memory.

title: Dorchester women injured after snowmobile hits multiple trees in N.H.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Two Dorchester women were injured after their snowmobile hit multiple trees in Columbia, New Hampshire, on Friday.
The crash occurred near Fish Pond when a 30-year-old first-time operator lost control and hit a snowbank.
The injured women were transported by Colebrook Fire Department to Upper Connecticut Valley Hospital for treatment.

title: Frederick Wiseman, the Bostonian who changed filmmaking forever
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Frederick Wiseman, renowned documentary filmmaker from Boston, passed away at 96 years old.
Wiseman's breakthrough film 'Titicut Follies' exposed abuses at Bridgewater State Hospital and was banned in Massachusetts until 1991.
His documentaries, like 'City Hall' and 'Welfare', are noted for their observational style and lack of narrative arcs.

title: Layoffs hit Boston Metal as company plans Woburn shutdown
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Boston Metal to lay off 71 employees in Woburn, effective March 14, following an industrial accident in Brazil.
The company will close its pilot plant, R&D building, main office, and warehouse in Woburn.
Boston Metal missed a financing milestone due to a critical equipment failure in Brazil, impacting its operations and funding.
